item.title: Ellen add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Ellen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "A man's mind is stretched by a new idea or sensation, and never shrinks back to its former dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Will Schwalbe
item.description: "Reading isn't the opposite of doing, it's the opposite of dying." -- Will Schwalbe

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Will Schwalbe
item.description: "We're all in the end-of-your-life book-club, whether we acknowledge it or not; each book we read may well be the last, each conversation the final one." -- Will Schwalbe

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Halldór Laxness
item.description: "For man is essentially alone, and one should pity him and love him and grieve with him." -- Halldór Laxness

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Gary Paulsen
item.description: "If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books. The book needs you." -- Gary Paulsen
